Detailed Description

This class uses a pool of native Windows threads to run tasks.

Member Function Documentation

void TaskManagerTP::Init ( void   )  [virtual]

Call this from the primary thread before calling any other TaskManagerTP methods.

Implements TaskManager.

void TaskManagerTP::Shutdown ( void   )  [virtual]

Call this from the primary thread as the last TaskManagerTP call.

Implements TaskManager.

void TaskManagerTP::IssueJobsForSystemTasks ( ISystemTask **  pTasks,
u32  uCount,
f32  fDeltaTime 
) [virtual]

Call this from the primary thread to schedule system work.

Parameters:
pTasks an array of ISystemTask objects which should have their Update() methods called asynchronously
uCount the size of the pTasks array
fDeltaTime amount of time to be passed to each system's Update method
See also:
TaskManagerTP::WaitForSystemTasks, ISystemTask::Update

Implements TaskManager.

void TaskManagerTP::WaitForAllSystemTasks ( void   ) 

Call this from the primary thread to wait until all tasks spawned with IssueJobsForSystemTasks and all of their subtasks are complete.

See also:
TaskManagerTP::IssueJobsForSystemTasks

void TaskManagerTP::WaitForSystemTasks ( ISystemTask **  pTasks,
u32  uCount 
) [virtual]

Call this from the primary thread to wait until specified tasks spawned with IssueJobsForSystemTasks and all of their subtasks are complete.

This method ignores its parameters and waits for all system tasks. This is adequate if each system is designed to run exactly once per frame.

Parameters:
pTasks an array of ISystemTask objects
uCount the length of the pTasks array
See also:
TaskManagerTP::IssueJobsForSystemTasks

Implements TaskManager.

u32 TaskManagerTP::GetNumberOfThreads ( void   ) 

Call this method to get the number of threads in the thread pool which are active for running work.

Returns:
the number of threads being used

void TaskManagerTP::SetNumberOfThreads ( u32  uNumberOfThreads  )  [virtual]

Parameters:
uNumberOfThreads the limit of the number of threads to use

This method constrains the number of threads used by the TaskManagerTP.

Implements Interface::ITaskManager.

void TaskManagerTP::NonStandardPerThreadCallback ( JobFunction  pfnCallback,
void *  pData 
) [virtual]

This method triggers a synchronized callback to be called once by each thread used by the TaskManagerTP. This method which should only be called during initialization and shutdown of the TaskManagerTP. This method waits until all callbacks have executed.

Parameters:
pfnCallback the function callback to execute
pData a pointer to data that is passed to the callback

u32 TaskManagerTP::GetRecommendedJobCount ( ITaskManager::JobCountInstructionHints  Hints  )  [virtual]

Call this method to determine the ideal number of tasks to submit to the TaskManagerTP for maximum performance. Hints is ignored and the number of active threads is always returned.

Parameters:
Hints guidance on the type of work done in the jobs about to be submitted
Returns:
the number of jobs which is optimal for the type of work specified by Hints
